title: What could make evil justifiable? - Quora

response.answer_text: A single human mind. I suspect that every icon of evil that could be trotted out never had the thought “I am going to go out and do evil today.” I suspect that most thought that they were fighting evil. Joe Stalin probably thought that all of those he had purged were preventing him from doing what was need to be done for Russia to succeed.

Read the second chapter of “Rules for Radicals” by Alinsky. (spelling?) I was almost convinced. Almost. One needs to understand moral relativism and then play devils advocate to question it, like I have for the last several years to myself. There are some religions that see God as composed as the devil and God as facets of one supreme being. (Gnostics?) In “the philosophy of ethics” class in college a hypothetical was posed: “if you were in a space ship and landed on a planet where a resource was needed for the survival of your species, but getting out of the spaceship would kill an intelligent species that lived there would you do it?” I recognized that doing and ethics are not the same. Lawful evil. Unlawful good etc. No one could answer so I broke it with: “It’s wrong but I would do it”. The class thought that was funny - a response I did not expect. I never said I wasn’t evil.
